trails.name: Woods Hollow Nature Preserve
trails.overview: Woods Hollow Nature Preserve is a 1.9 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Ballston Spa, New York that features beautiful wild flowers and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is best used from March until October. Dogs are also able to use this trail.

trails.name: Appalachian Trail: Highway 17A to Little Dam Lake
trails.overview: Appalachian Trail: Highway 17A to Little Dam Lake is a 9.2 mile moderately trafficked point-to-point trail located near Warwick, New York that features a waterfall and is rated as difficult. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail.

trails.name: Stone Valley Trail
trails.overview: Stone Valley Trail is a 7.2 mile out and back trail located near Potsdam, New York that features a waterfall and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail.

trails.name: Abbott Loop Trail
trails.overview: Abbott Loop Trail is a 7.9 mile lightly trafficked loop trail located near Spencer, New York that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as difficult. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

trails.name: Grimes Glen
trails.overview: Grimes Glen is a 1 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Naples, New York that features a waterfall and is rated as moderate. The trail is primarily used for hiking, walking, nature trips, and birding and is best used from March until September. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.
